snippet.title: Why Is Everyone Talking About Lynx? The Architectâ€™s Breakdown
snippet.description:
Talk: Xuan Huang - "Lynx: Unlock Native for More", React Summit 2025

Lynx, a new cross-platform stack adopted by the TikTok app that empowers teams to ship truly native UIs to mobile and web from a single codebase using their existing web skills like CSS and React, has recently been open sourced.

In this talk, we'll explore what makes Lynx familiar and what sets it apart from other cross-platform technologies; weâ€™ll take a closer look at its dual-threaded design, and how that enables Lynx's instant launches and silky-smooth interactions, plus a sneak peak at what's next for Lynx.

Watch the full talk with Q&A on GitNation website: https://gitnation.com/contents/lynx-unlock-native-for-more

Follow the link to watch the full version of all the conference talks, QnAâ€™s with speakers and hands-on workshop recordings â†’ https://gitnation.com/events/react-summit-2025

snippet.title: Mateusz JagodziÅ„ski - Zero-Styling Development: Utopia or the Future of Frontend?
snippet.description:
Talk: Mateusz JagodziÅ„ski - "Zero-Styling Development: Utopia or the Future of Frontend?", React Summit 2025

What if you never had to touch styles in your code again? This lightning talk presents a real-world approach to fully automated design implementation â€” where changes in Figma are automatically reflected in the app via tokens and a CI pipeline. A practical look at what happens when you give full visual control to designers, and why that might be a good thing for developers, too.

Audience Takeaways:

- A provocative perspective: does a frontend dev really need to write styles?
- Tools and techniques to sync Figma â†’ GitHub â†’ CSS â†’ Web app.
- A rethink of responsibilities between designers and developers.

Watch the full talk with Q&A on GitNation website: https://gitnation.com/contents/zero-styling-development-utopia-or-the-future-of-frontend

Follow the link to watch the full version of all the conference talks, QnAâ€™s with speakers and hands-on workshop recordings â†’  gitnation.com/events/react-summit-2025

snippet.title: JJ Kasper - Next.js Adapters: Build Once, Deploy Everywhere
snippet.description:
Talk: JJ Kasper - "Next.js Adapters: Build Once, Deploy Everywhere", React Summit 2025

Tired of bending your deployment process to fit Next.js? With the power of adapters, you can now deploy your app seamlessly to a variety of platforms â€” from the cloud to your local dev cave. In this talk, weâ€™ll explore how adapters simplify the deployment pipeline and make Next.js feel right at home, no matter where itâ€™s hosted.

snippet.title: Rahul Nanwani - Delivering High-Quality Videos on Your ReactJS Website
snippet.description:
Talk: Rahul Nanwani  - "Delivering High-Quality Videos on Your ReactJS Website", React Summit 2025

Video is the most powerful and engaging content format currently on the web. With mobile-first experiences becoming the norm, users expect high-quality, smooth video playback, whether they're watching on a fast Wi-Fi connection or a spotty mobile network.

However, delivering optimized video content is not easy. Challenges like adaptive streaming, efficient compression, fast loading times, and responsive playback make it tricky to balance quality and performance. This lightning talk will focus on implementing adaptive bitrate streaming in ReactJS to ensure videos play seamlessly on mobile and on-the-fly thumbnail generation to enhance user experience â€” all with minimal setup!

Watch the full talk with Q&A on GitNation website: https://gitnation.com/contents/delivering-high-quality-videos-on-your-reactjs-website

Follow the link to watch the full version of all the conference talks, QnAâ€™s with speakers and hands-on workshop recordings â†’  gitnation.com/events/react-summit-2025

snippet.title: Edoardo Dusi - Server Components Wars: PHP Strikes Back
snippet.description:
Talk: Edoardo Dusi - "Server Components Wars: PHP Strikes Back", React Summit 2025

Server Components is a new pattern for the JavaScript world, but in this lightning talk, you'll see how easy it is to understand if we compare it to another old web language, one that shaped web development as we know it: PHP!

snippet.title: Ido Moshe - Efficient Data Visualisation with React and SVG
snippet.description:
Talk: Ido Moshe - "Efficient Data Visualisation with React and SVG", React Summit 2025

See how far simple charts in React and SVG can take you, and where their limits start to surface. We'll explore the sweet spot of using React's declarative model with plain SVG elements and a touch of D3 for utility functions like scaling and path generation, before reaching the performance and complexity ceilings that call for something more robust.

Watch the full talk with Q&A on GitNation website: https://gitnation.com/contents/efficient-data-visualisation-with-react-and-svg
